intro: Senecio apiifolius, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its yellow flowers appear in late summer, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Senecio apiifolius is considered a weed in many regions but has also been used in traditional herbal medicine.
